Fales Library and Special Collections
Curt Royston Papers
Royston, Curt
Royston, Curt
MSS.259
2.8 Linear Feet in 2 manuscript boxes, 1 record carton, and 1 film can.

1982-2000 The Curt Royston Papers consists of reviews, promotional matierals, transparencies, film, and video recordings relating to Royston's career as a filmmaker. Materials date from 1982 to 2000. Some materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Curt Royston in 2009 and 2014. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2009.259 and 2014.259.
Arrangement
This collection is arranged into four series by format.
Series I: Reviews
Series II: Transparencies
Series III: Film
Series IV: Video recordings
Biographical Note
Curt Royston is best known for his proficiency in a variety of media: painting, sculpture, photography, film, and video, and often in combination. His work has been shown extensively throughout the United States and Europe including a 1987 one-man exhibition at the Whitney Museum of American Art.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Curt Royston Papers; MSS 259; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Processing Information
In 2018 materials from accretion 2014.259 were processed and intellectually incorporated into the collection. Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes.
Related Material at Fales Library and Special Collections
Lisa Fox and Curt Royston Papers (MSS 249).
Scope and Contents
This collection contains reviews, promotional matierals, transparencies, film, and video recordings relating to Curt Royston's career as a filmmaker. Materials date from 1982 to 2000.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Curt Royston was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
